entry.title: Game: Final Fantasy 7 (Bootleg Mods) (Steam, 1997) (4)
entry.content:
Game: Final Fantasy 7 (Bootleg Mods) (Steam, 1997) (4)20131227
I spent most of the morning trying to fix the music problem. I
eventually decided it was in part because my hard drive was slow
(it's external), so I decided to create a partition on my SSD for
Windows. In the process I accidentally deleted my save. I tried
for a little bit to fix it with Black Chocobo, but couldn't get
the event progress numbers to be the correct thing. Bummer.

I don't want to immediately replay and I couldn't load some saves
for the PC version I found online either. So, I will call that
quits.

I'll play this game again eventually, but I'm disheartened now. As
far as Bootleg goes, I found the graphics to be okay (for the
reasons mentioned before), the UI/speed to be AWESOME, and the
music to be better (except that it always broke).

Total time: 15:39
  • Video Games
  • Final Fantasy 7 (Bootleg Mods)
  • Steam
  • 1997

"Disc 1" and watched Aerith die. Something flaked out about the
music, so it wasn't as impactful as it could have been, but it was
still pretty powerful. This game is great.

entry.content:
Game: New Super Mario Brothers Wii (Wii, 2009) (4)20131225
In honor of getting a Wii U for Christmas, my wife and I decided
to go back to NSMBW and finish getting all the Star Coins. We
played for about an hour and a half with our kids and got four or
five coins and a secret exit. It was super fun. I love these
games.

entry.title: Game: Final Fantasy 7 (Bootleg Mods) (Steam, 1997) (2)
entry.content:
Game: Final Fantasy 7 (Bootleg Mods) (Steam, 1997) (2)20131224
I played for about four hours this morning and got out of
Midgar. Something I failed to mention in the original post that is
kind of cool is that since I'm playing on PC, I can use a SNES
controller. The game only uses 2D movement, so it works really
well. Midgar is always memorable for me because I remember getting
out the first day I played and feeling that the game was going to
be huge.

I'm cheating a tiny bit because I'm using an AP boosting thing. I
find the materia development system in the game to take far too
long and require far too much grinding. So far it hasn't been game
breaking because I have impoverished MP and can't effectively use
the spells I unlock.

--

I got really sick after my first round of the game and took a long
nap. When I woke up, I played again for the rest of the night,
about five hours. I got to the middle of Cosmo Canyon. I had one
major set-back where I did at Dyne and didn't save after I ended
Corel Canyon. That was very brutal. I also had a hard time getting
Yuffie because of the green monsters that petrify you. I'm not
sure I will use her, but it is nice to have everyone in the game.

Total time: 10:26
  • Video Games
  • Final Fantasy 7 (Bootleg Mods)
  • Steam
  • 1997

I finished the International B license tests today. On the fourth
one, I got 18.001 secs but the Gold time was 18.000; it was very
painful. The dirt race was very hard, but once I turned off the
stability system I was able to get a big boost, but it took a
while to get it under control.

entry.title: Game: Final Fantasy 7 (Bootleg Mods) (Steam, 1997)
entry.content:
Game: Final Fantasy 7 (Bootleg Mods) (Steam, 1997)20131221
I took me a long time to install the Bootleg system after buying
this game on Steam. Once it was all ready, it was very hard to
decide which mods to use, because there isn't a lot of
description. I picked a good preset and tried to look into a few
of them.

I like the way of things look, particularly the UI. I like the new
soundtrack I chose. But, I think my favourite part is the speed of
everything. The new graphics are a little bit jarring because
everything doesn't have a consistent style (during a single scene)
like the game originally did. For instance, the "Advent Children"
style models walking next to the blocky Avalanche members look
really weird.

I'm enjoying the game so far too, I'm about to really get into the
second mission.

Total time: 1:40
  • Video Games
  • Final Fantasy 7 (Bootleg Mods)
  • Steam
  • 1997

entry.title: Game: Gran Turismo 6 (PS3, 2013) (8)
entry.content:
Game: Gran Turismo 6 (PS3, 2013) (8)20131221
I played for about three hours today. I did the National B license
test and it was SO frustrating and took SO long. I also worked on
some of the mission races. I really hate the tests and missions
because they don't follow the same rules as the rest of the
game. I finally beat the test (all gold) and went on to the next
level and did the first set of races in the X-Bow. That car feels
really good to drive.

National A - 18% - 30 - 123 - 16 - 87 - 41 - $498.805k

Total time: 14:38

  • Gran Turismo 6
  • PS3

entry.content:

entry.title: Cosmos: A Personal Voyage - Season 1 - Episode 5 - Blues for a Red Planet
entry.content:
Cosmos: A Personal Voyage - Season 1 - Episode 5 - Blues for a Red Planet20131220
I was fascinated by all the details of the Martian exploratory
vehicles. It was also exciting to think about terraforming with
plants. It's cool to think of plants as machines.

entry.title: Movie: Rumble in the Bronx, starring Jackie Chan (1995)
entry.content:
Movie: Rumble in the Bronx, starring Jackie Chan (1995)20131219
This is an amazing *REDACTED*ie Chan movie, one of my family's
favourites. My wife didn't like it though, because she thought the
acting and plot were terrible. I like what Roger Ebert said:

"Any attempt to defend this movie on rational grounds is
futile. Don't tell me about the plot and the dialogue. Don't dwell
on the acting. The whole point is *REDACTED*ie Chan â€“ and, like Astaire
and Rogers, he does what he does better than anybody. There is a
physical confidence, a grace, an elegance to the way he
moves. There is humor to the choreography of the fights (which are
never too gruesome). He's having fun. If we allow ourselves to get
in the right frame of mind, so are we."
  • Movies
  • 1995

entry.title: Movie: Video Game High School: Season 2, starring Josh Blaylock (2013)
entry.content:
Movie: Video Game High School: Season 2, starring Josh Blaylock (2013)20131218
The first season was awesome and I was amazed at how much cooler
and well produced the second season was. The Hollywood actors and
cameos were particularly awesome. I like that Jenny and Josh were
together. They're so cute together.
  • Movies
  • 2013

entry.title: Movie: Video Game High School: Season 1, starring Josh Blaylock (2012)
entry.content:
Movie: Video Game High School: Season 1, starring Josh Blaylock (2012)20131218
This was an amazing Web series. The writing is incredibly clever
and the concept is beautifully absurd. It reminds me of a cross
between Buffy and a golden-era Nickelodeon show.
